treatment.description: Plants erect, not mat- or mound-forming, 1–3 m; twigs usually glabrous, rarely sparsely short-hairy. Petioles 8–12 mm, smooth, glabrous. Inflorescences: axis usually glabrous, sometimes sparsely short-hairy; bracts glabrous or sparsely short-hairy. 2n = 26.
treatment.discussion: Subspecies stanfordiana is widespread in the interior northern Coast Ranges.
